author: Nightshroud99
title: Preety Good Set
review:
This is a pretty good set; nice parts, two minifigures, and great playability for younger kids.

PROS:
Dark Brown Hairpiece: The hairpiece isn't light brown its dark, I've never seen lego hair this color.
Two Minifigures: You get the guy from the granite grinder and the guy from boulder blaster/ crystal sweeper (metal plate on his head)
Nice pieces: Especially the piece that hold the jackhamemr on the miners body; it has alot of mod potential.
Crystal King is very fun to play with

CONS:
Crystal King could be a little taller, but this is easily fixed.
Needs some crystals on the kings legs

Overall this is a very cool set imo. The Crystal Kings name is also Rockrage if you wanted to know. Anyway check out my lego reviews on youtube! http://www.youtube.com/user/Nightshroud99

author: mr_brightside711
title: Can you smell, what the Rock, is cooking?!
review:
I just ordered this set at legoshop and it took 12 days to get here to japan. including the weekend. This is a good one though+.

Very short and simple build but they kept me interested.

The minifingers are very cool and the first P.M. set under $30.00 with more then one minifigure! yahhh!

Pros:
good price
2 minifigures
Miner drill
4 lime green crystals
Dynamite stick
Posable
He can hold both miners
New peices
Spikes
Head Piece
Mouth opens
No stickers!
Only one Con

Best Feature:
The crystal king has a huge mouth for eating those crystals...
or miners! :]

Cons:
small-ish legs

This is a must have for the collection of Power Miners sets. Plus you will have a rock monster big enough to deal with some of the bigger sets like the crystal sweeper and rock wrecker. or least thats what he deals with for me! but seriously! IF YOU DONT HAVE THIS BIG GUY, YOU CAN'T CALL YOURSELF A POWER MINERS FAN!

author: ancient_collector
title: Amazing
review:
I rarely write set reviews, but this set is worth one. Probably the nicest addition to the Power Miners theme, a real foe, as opposed to regular little rock monsters, finally able to challenge those big and though mining vehicles.

The Crystal King itself is actually amazing, being 16cm tall, a giant compared to usual minifig and most vehicles, and possesing a lot of junctions, which allow a full set of movements: it can stand, "walk", grab things in its three-finger hands or completely rotare its forearm and shoulder.

The King structure also features a very good combination of old-style gray bricks and some new ones, like those long sharpen spikes (speaking of which, the tips are made of rubber, so they can be bended without trouble) or the head. Personally, I don't like big monolithic pieces, but this time it represents the best choice, allowing the large mouth to be more solid and resistent.

Two minifigs are also included, and the portable driller is a nice note, well integrating with the King.

author: Jakelegofilms
title: GIANT ROCK MONSTER ON THE LOOSE!!
review: My dad ordered this on line for me after we tried to buy it in Florida.  The LEGO store was out of it, even though we checked EVERY day.  When the UPS guy delivered it, I was really excited.  I am happy they made this giant monster king, it is so cool.  I like that it's mouth can open and close and eat the miners and drilling weapon.  It's cool that the fingers can grab the miners too.  It's a great set.  Now there are 3 different size monsters to play with.  It would be cool if it had some crystals on it's legs.  Two thumbs up!!

author: stevethebandit
title: could be better.
review:
this was my first power miners set. i got it at halloween. its pretty good, but not too perfect.Here is the review.       

1.minifigs
Miner#1 is useful, he has a dual-sided head,a drill symbol is on the chest,and a metal plate on the head.he has a helmet with goggles.Printed legs and back. Miner#2 is not as good, but nice to have, he looks dirty and has a bomb symbol on the chest. another mutt williams hairpiece is super,but sadly no helmet. a helmet and hairpiece would be good.8/10.        

2.accessories
a stick of dynamite,4 trans-green crystals,and a drill.THe drill is x-tra good,because of nice desigs and pieces.it spins.9/10       

3.the crystal king
a dissapointment,i mean come on lego, it cant even eat the dynamite/crystals.they falll out.he has a nice-angeled neck and 3 new pieces (chest/arm armor.head and knifes)his legs is bad because they only have 2 joints and is too short.arms have 3 fingers, wich can hold a miner.head is also good, because it has jaws that move up and down, and 5 knives.    

price. 19.99 usd. 7/10.overall, get the set, you wont regret it.8/10.

author: legoguy2805
title: RockRage... or is it?
review:
This was, basically, THE set for 2009. When the first leaked images were released, people were amazed and desperately wanted the set to come out as soon as possible. Then eventually when it was showcased at ToyFair, some people didn't think it was as good as the leaks suggested, but still downright awesome: the king of the Rock Monsters!

Then in August it was released, and lots of Lego fans bought it. When the Power Miners website story section was updated to feature the summer 2009 Rock Monsters, Crystal King's name was actually RockRage, but later on it was changed to CrystalKing. This led to fanfics and speculation, but the name RockRage was probably a prototype name.

I however didn't receive this set until Christmas, with my brother. Here is what I thought of it:

Pros:
King of the Rock Monsters, duh
Stands up
No stickers!
Includes two miners with drill and dynamite
Posable limbs/fingers
Posable jaw

Cons:
Fingers fall off
Smaller than you'd expect him to be
Fingers can't really grip well
Giant hole in bottom of mouth, so if he eats anything it just falls out

Overall, it is a decent set, although not as good as some people expected him to be.

author: Kalhiki
title: Very nice design, but lacking in some posability.
review:
So, the Crystal King... First, the Minifigs.

First, you have a regular Power Miner.... Not much. I don't actually have these guys with me at the moment, so I'm doing it by memory. He also has a big drill which looks cool, but it can be hard to stand the fig up due to the drill's size. There is no function to turn the drill, you have to do it manually.

The other minifig is a little different. He's got the basic legs and body, but he has no helmet. Instead he has hair. It's an interesting move, but it's odd because he's one of the guys fighting the King. Shouldn't he have a helmet?

The Crystal King himself is a good looking figure. The only problem I have with his appearence are his feet. First of all, they're really flat. I think Lego could have incorporated some SNOT (Studs Not Only on Top) into the feet. It also could have easily had ball jointed ankles instead of hinges. This can be fixed, but I haven't because I don't have any of the needed pieces. Another minor problem is his mouth. Open, you can see a gaping hole between the top and bottom jaws. 

The Color scheme is great. Mainly it's transparent green and shades of grey. Mainly it's Sulfurix or Geolix on a larger scale. He also has a cool new piece on his chest and hands. They seem to bee a remake of an older piece only with bumped up grey areas like the small rock monsters. Posability is... fine. He can open and close his mouth and also has two joints in his neck. He has ball jointed shoulders, but due to how they're hooked up, you can't get his arms straight down. Luckily, he has wrist ball joints and moveable fingers. Now to the legs. He has ball jointed hips, but no knees. And the inward hinges on his ankles make it even worse.

20 dollars is an okay deal. 15 dollars would have been perfect, but I'm fine with 20. In conclusion this is worthy to be the King of the Rock Monsters. If there was a small vehicle, it would be better, but the drill works. I do recommend getting this set if you get the chance.

There is this huge spike that can move up and down on his back. The other interesting pieces are the piece that attaches the drill to the miner and a brown Agent Chase hairpiece.

pros:
Very pose-able.
Interesting pieces.
crystal armor.
Three spikes.

cons:
none.

In all a great set to own. Get this for a starting Power Miner set.

author: TheFadedTBCap
title: The Most Dangerous Rock Monster Ever
review:
I got this set for my birthday and it is so cool.  Can the Power Miners stop this ferocious beast, or is he too powerful?  I enjoy playing with this set, it is AWESOME!

Pros:

- About 7 inches tall (I measured)
- Movable arms and legs
- Crystal King's mouth opens really wide
- Hands that can grab stuff
- Includes a cool drill, dynamite, and four crystal

Cons:

- Legs don't have knees
- Fingers are fragile
- Crystals break off

Has two mini figures and one giant monster. This is an awesome set and you should get it .

author: alva
title: The king of Power Miner Theme
review:
I just bought this set yesterday from a friend of mine.
I am not really a big fan of power miner theme, and I dont like other set they come with.
But this set is really tempting me to buy from the very first time I saw it. Never bought it before, cause I think the set will not match with my city collection.
After I saw the lego movie (the adv of clutch power), I knew I have to own one of this.

Built it yesterday and I amaze with the simplicity of the design. It is really simple. But the final result is amazing. The king is really a king in term of the size. Really nice and very detailed monster.

What I dont like about the set is the feet part. They feel too plain and too bulky to be a rock monster feet.

But other than that, this set is really great.

You should grab one of this, eventhough you are not a power miner fans.
Right now, I am thinking of creating an army of rock monster because of this set. I think it will be fun to look at different colors of rock monsters standing in one line lead by the crystal king.

I hope Lego also can come with other Crystal King in different colors, so I can make an army of Crystal King:P

author: KLOKRIECHER
title: Awsome monster!
review:
The Crystal King set (8962) is a LEGO Power Miners set which came out in 2009. It comes with 2 minifigs and 168 pieces. This set does include no decals and there're no mistakes in the instructions and no missing pieces.

[img]http://www.klokriecher.de/gallery_pics/l/8962-1.jpg[/img]

Minifigures:

  • Miner 1: The first miner has a metal plate on his head and he is wearing a blue helmet with gray goggles. The head and the torso are double-sided and the miner has printed legs. On the picture of the box and of the instruction you can see that he also comes with a driller which spins full 360Â°.
  • Miner 2: The second miner comes with the same torso and with the same legs. The only thing which is different about him is the face. He's also has a brown hair piece and a piece of dynamite. On his face he looks very serious and he also has a double-sided head.
Crystal King:

The Christal King is as tall as a Bionicle figure and the legs, the arms, the fingers, the feet and the head are all movable. The mouth can be opened and the head can also be attached to a Bionicle figure if you want to build some cool MOC's (my own creations). He also comes with some crystals and transparent yellow pieces which makes him looking awsome!

Positive:

Minifigures
Great pieces which you can youse for brickfilms or MOC's
Nice starter set
Price
Play features
No Stickers
Head can be attached to a Bionicle figure!

Negative:

Might be a little bit to small for older kids and adults.

All in all it's a great set to get and I would highly recommend you to get this model. You can find this set on eBay, BrickLink and Amazon for sure. Here is the link where you can check out the full galery I made for this set on my website: http://www.klokriecher.de/

Videos I made of this set:

Stopmotion
Review

author: Dragon_Master_48
title: The King of the Rock Monsters emerges...
review:
Despite me having a personal dislike for the Power Miners theme, this was one set that caught my eye. It is, in my opinion, a wonderful example of the best the theme has to offer.

Pros

  • The mighty Crystal King!
  • Not one, but TWO miners.
  • The Crystal King is relatively stable when standing.
  • The Crystal King can hold a miner in his hand, and eat one.
  • Very flexible joints. This set combines standard system bricks with Technic-joint pieces very well.

Cons

  • The drill looks too big for Rex to have; I would have added a few more pieces and made a small drill-vehicle.
  • No Rock Monster minifigure.

Overall, this set, despite a few issues, is a very good set, and I would recommend it to any LEGO fan looking either to expand their collection or just to find a fun set to display/build.

author: Legojii
title: Fee Fi Fo Fum..Im the Crystal King and here i come
review:
I'm a really big fan of the Power Miners sets as they kind of remind me of the semi-military core of engineers, ready to work but if problem arises they will kick it into 5th gear. They have always had little rock monsters to fight that give them a problem if they eat the crystals and the big monster rock throwers that tower over the little guys so if there is a monster that calls itself the "Crystal King" how much damage you think this guy can bring?

Personally i like this set, its a great set into the series. Its like a big boss villain that is not of mimifig size and looks like hes mean enough to eat some. a lot could also be said of his hight and that he is not very tall which is true but its the fact that there is a monster that could go toe to toe with the Power Miners mech that just makes me want to set up a diorama with this in mind.

  • Cons: 
  • Hes kinda small
  • No knee articulation 
  • The power miners that come in the set have a drill backpack to fight him while the other guy just has dynamite ( i wish they both had a backpack you can config into a weapon )

  • Proes:
  • Awesome joints in the arms
  • Really cool clear bricks with partially painted motif make interesting chest and arm plates 
  • Some say that get spikes on the back that fall off but mine doesn't

Over all a cool set to antagonize the miners..now if only i had a miner mech.      
  •

author: AETerry
title: Crystal King Review
review:
I have had this set for a while now and am reviewing it now as my family recently went to LEGOland California. While watching their 4D Lego Movie with Clutch Powers, my daughter got very excited with how: Mama! You have that set! Referring of course, to the Crystal King who appears in it and this set review.

This is currently the only Power Miners set that I have. When I first saw Power Miners come out, I thought of the Rock Raiders from some years back. So not many of the sets have had me really wanting to get something that didn't feel like a repeat of an older theme.

At $20 the price is a bit steep... I'd have preferred $15 for this set. And I remember back to the 80's and mid 90's when if a set like this would have come out, it probably would have cost $10-$15... so a part of me wants to keep in mind inflation.

Instructions

The instructions are in booklet form following LEGO's clear, easy to follow step-by-step instructions. And as many newer sets are starting to show, there is also a listing of all the parts used in this set and their catalog number should replacements ever be needed.

Parts

There are a total of 168 pieces in this set. Most notable are the ball joint pieces for the arms of the Crystal King and his head which is fairly unique.

Minifigures

There are two Power Miner Minifigures in this set. One carrying a bundle of dynamite in a desperate or bold move to try and blow up the Crystal King with and the other wields and carries a large mobile drill with which to try attacking the giant rock monster with. Both are very well detailed and the minifigure heads have dual printings on them so you can have some changes in expressions of determination or fear.

The build and completed model

The main build of this set is the Crystal King himself. This is my first set making use of these ball-joint pieces and I must say, they have captured my imagination. The possibilities with these for other builds with Robots and even animals are endless.

He alternates with light and dark grey pieces and highlights of neon yellow crystals and spikes coming from his head and shoulders. He's fairly impressive and the finger are well articulated too, enough so you can pose the Crystal King as holding one of the Power Miner figures as they battle it out with him.

My one real complaint with him is the lack of knee articulation. It seems there could have been more and the legs look too short compared to the articulation of the arms.

Summary

This Crystal King set is definitely one of those LEGO sets that captures my imagination and speaks clearly to why it is I love LEGO and building with their bricks. He remains even today proudly displayed on my shelf of LEGO models for show. I just love this set and am very glad I picked it up when I did, even though I feel he's a bit pricey, he was well worth it.
